Inside Out: The Story of a Brand - AMA Phoenix

"Being a Cleveland Clinic caregiver means I play a role in patient care; even though I am not a doctor or nurse.  It means being selfless, and understanding that I am here to assist patients who look to us for comfort and support throughout their experience with Cleveland Clinic," says Raymond Jackson, Outpatient Lab Dept. Supervisor III, Tomsich Pathology and Laboratory Medicine Institute.
Join Raymond in providing comfort to others today! http://cle.clinic/2xngsz2
The amazing marketing event team at #ESF17 in London - great crew! great event!
Nico Lutkins @Justin Shriber Orla Walton Christina O'Connor Jacqui Quigley Keith Browning Judy Tian Martina Cianfrocca Siobhan Waters
Angel MedFlight Worldwide Air Ambulance Services

I manage content strategy and brand voice to engage and support healthcare providers and their patients. I work with Marketing, Business Development, and our advocates in the C-suite. Together, we partner with Centers of Excellence and other healthcare providers to reach patients online, promote Thought Leadership in the healthcare community, and highlight life-changing rehabilitation programs.

I lead the AMA PHX Comm team and collaborate with other marketers and other chapter board members to bring more networking and learning opportunities to the local marketing community. Learn about our latest events at amaphoenix.org.

KEY ACHIEVEMENTS:Led company re-brand and launched digital content strategy resulting in greater brand recognition online and subsequent shares of company media by major industry publications (and competitors); driving webinar registrations and attendance numbers and resulting lead numbers to new highs; consistently increasing traffic; and growing the company's following online by 4x. Under my leadership and with valuable involvement from partnering departments, year-over-year achievements included:• 15,000 more first-time visitors on the company website• 628 more attendees on average registered per webinar• Over 2,000 more leads generated• Introduced weekly ICD-10 memes and Buzz Feed style posts that were syndicated by the industry's largest digital ICD-10 publication and generated more organic and referral traffic than any previous site content.Marketing also implemented Act-On Marketing Automation which attributed $130K in revenue tied to marketing initiatives in just six months.

KEY ACHIEVEMENTS:• Supported executive team in securing thousands in advertising and exhibiting funds byspearheading advertising strategy, collaborating on co-exhibiting opportunities.• Pioneered and launched company digital content strategy resulting in greater brand recognition online; consistently increasing traffic and contributing over 40% of referral traffic to Salucro.com.• Strategized and implemented pre-show communications ahead of major conferences, pulling in more than 140 physician practice groups.• Chaired joint multi-media Trusted Partner campaign alongside colleagues at PayPal and with third party agencies. Drove meticulous collaboration among the Executive Team and board members to ensure the final outcome aligned with their vision and goals for the company.• Spearheaded Forward, a thought leadership program dedicated to positioning Subject Matter Experts throughout the Healthcare Finance community to promote progress which has received national recognition throughout the industry. Blog posts and interviews contributed from industry leaders (through networking online) have fostered a 'big brand' feel for the 40-person company.

KEY ACHIEVEMENTS:• Negotiation skills yielded thousands in advertising and agency costs.• Project manager for full site launch of CosmeticBraces.com, a unique resource for consumers and orthodontists.• Contributed to sales increase for Q3 with marketing promotions tailored directly to customer needs and promoted via Sales department and online marketing outlets.• Spearheaded Online Marketing B2B Testimonial campaign for main product offering which directly resulted in increased sales in the U.S. and European regions.• Conserved $80,000.00 in media costs while increasing measurable ROI by moving almost half of paid advertising to online mediums.• Introduced testimonial ad campaign across various mediums that resulted in a ten percent growth in new customers for the target product.• Received direct recognition from CEO and Vice President of Global Marketing for pioneering a global newsletter for orthodontists that had been in the works for more than three years.

Naomi is hands down one of the best Marketing Directors I have had the privilege to work with. I was particularly impressed by Naomi’s ability to create fresh concepts for company media that went viral —and effortlessly. Copy Editor, GuideLive at The Dallas Morning News
January 30, 2017, Sarah reported directly to Naomi

Naomi took a chance hiring me as the copy editor at VitalWare, and I am so glad she did. Being a part of her team was truly an incredible experience. She allowed me to hone my skills every day, and pushed me to be the best I could be in my job. Naomi is a great leader. Her team doubled in size in only six months, and she handled the transition incredibly well. There was never a day that went by that she didn't reach out to me to help with my work or make sure things were going alright. I started my time at VitalWare with little experience in anything other than copy editing, and in less than a year, Naomi helped me expand my skill set exponentially. I can't stress enough how much she improved VitalWare's marketing in just a year, and I know she will continue to do amazing things in the future.

Chargemaster Management / Hospital Pricing / ICD10 Audits/ Revenue Capture
July 13, 2016, Naomi worked with Craig in the same group

Naomi is a Top Notch marketing professional who understands how to create a marketing message that speaks louder than any sales pitch. I worked with Naomi at VitalWare where she leads the Marketing department. She excels at identifying and understanding brand positioning in a way that enhances the company image. The best part of interacting with Naomi is her creative, strategic approach and ability to always bring the WOW factor!   Naomi is an expert in her field and has a contagious, positive attitude that is a pleasure to be around. Her love of technology and digital media are obvious. At VitalWare, she’s promoted the importance of social selling and brand advocacy to keep the entire company and their connections engaged, broadening the brand’s organic reach. Her digital strategy and lead gen efforts have increased qualified prospects for the Sales team, grown the brand online, and driven demand and attendance for company webinars that now frequently book completely. Naomi is a huge asset to VitalWare and would be to any business looking to grow. I’d welcome the opportunity to work with her again in the future.

June 13, 2016, Ashlee reported directly to Naomi

Few people get the opportunity to work directly with a manager like Naomi. She is a true marketing maven and mentor. Since joining VitalWare as the Director of Marketing, she has worked to take the brand to a new level. Her leadership and experience have put VitalWare on the map through new and inventive online initiatives. I am impressed by Naomi’s intuition and ability to lead a team. She pivots from project to project with ease, helping those around her better their skill sets through her leadership. Naomi has been able to bring a freshness to VitalWare’s marketing department. She is knowledgeable of the latest trends, in both marketing and healthcare, delivering new business and brand awareness through her content marketing efforts and overall marketing strategy.Naomi has used every opportunity to continue to help me grow and learn in my career, and I am a better marketing professional because of her. She would be a strong asset to any team.

Vice President
September 18, 2015, Naomi worked with Clint in the same group

It's rare that you come across a standout talent like Naomi. I had the pleasure of working with her for two years at Salucro, collaborating on multiple Business Development initiatives. Naomi headed up all Marketing, Events and Creative, and her ability to juggle multiple projects was unlike any I’ve seen before. I was always in awe of the brand she cultivated at Salucro—even on limited resources, her efforts made the company look more established and larger than life.I am especially impressed with how Naomi partnered with the Business Development team on Creative -even involving us as contributors in posts targeted to prospects we provided in our regions- she empowered us as Brand Ambassadors, giving us more opportunities to start a dialogue with vetted leads. Her print and digital Direct Marketing efforts assisted in driving our meetings at the HFMA ANI this year. She is a true leader; you could never hope to work with someone friendlier or more professional. I would welcome the opportunity to work with Naomi again in the future.

Recruiting Zander is hands down the greatest decision I’ve made since I joined the Phoenix American Marketing Association Board. His involvement has changed everything for our chapter, and made it possible to reach more marketers across the valley. Zander is an amazing content marketer. He is articulate, understands how to engage specific audiences and knows how to write for different mediums. He is SEO savvy and fluent in Wordpress, MailChimp, and is a quick study when it comes to any new software. He’s also friendly, approachable, and fun to work with, I couldn’t recommend Zander more.

February 7, 2017, Naomi worked with Melissa in different groups

What struck me immediately about Melissa is her poise and polished business acumen. She is a complete professional and a natural leader; I’ve always been inspired by both. I had the pleasure of collaborating with Melissa on our outbound and inbound Sales and Marketing initiatives at VitalWare where she quickly became a trusted resource who Marketing could rely on for meaningful feedback. Melissa is a  no-nonsense, results-driven Sales professional who asks the important questions and highlights challenges the Sales team faces to Marketing and other stakeholders in order to find more creative and responsive solutions. Watching Melissa in action redefined Inside Sales for myself and many stakeholders at the organization, highlighting the importance of this new role at VitalWare. She became a powerful partner to her Outside Sales Managers (connecting them with the right decision makers) and to all of us on the Marketing team (sharing ideas and uncovering blind spots we may not have noticed previously). Melissa was a constant source of positive energy and a pleasure to work with. I'd recommend her to any company that is looking to be more strategic in their Sales approach and to bridge the gap between Sales and Marketing efforts and initiatives.

summary: I have 10 years of experience in telling brand stories and increasing online lead gen, and exposure and five years of experience managing and mentoring up-and-comers. When I'm not at work or at a dog park, I freelance, volunteer on the board for the Phoenix American Marketing Association, and write about professional development. My articles have appeared on Mashable and Forbes.com and have been plugged by the New York Times online.
name: Naomi Garnice
title: Marketing Manager grabbing hearts, minds and iPhones with content that matters.
